Not a single instance can be ad- duced from the Scriptum, in which any prophet or apostle ascribes his own assurance of salvation to special revelation, or to any thing different from what he exhorts others to, in order to obtain and retain the same assurance. This concludes at least as strongly aga-inst those who ground their assurance on dreams, visions, and impressions of whatever kind, as those who say it can only bc enjoyed by immediate revelation.
